特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
関連科目:
The EU Economy.
This class is an English version of "Higashi-European Keizai" which will be held in the latter half of the spring semester. If you took any credit of "Higashi-European Keizai", you are not allowed to take this class.
授業の概要・背景: Students will be able to understand varieties of economies, societies and cultures, and also why our Japanese economic system is difficult to change, by learning the socialist economic system different from our market economic system, and the transition processes in eastern European economies.
授業方法:
This class is held in face to face format. Class materials will be uploaded at LUNA. For students permitted to take classes online, the class will be distributed as simultaneous two-way class via Zoom.
This class is held by quarter system (the latter half of the autumn semester). The first lecture will be given at 4th slot of Thursday in the eighth week. Thereafter lectures will be given at 3rd and 4th slot of each Thursday, and the final examination will be given at the 4th slot of Thursday in the 15th week.
If you have any questions, please ask them actively during or after the lecture.

評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
Students will be able to acquire the ability to understand and analyse the international affairs in Eastern European countries and the ability to understand cultural varieties and cohabitation between the EU and Japan, which are mentioned in the diploma policy of the School of International Studies.
